titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Central Index FA736

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-11-01 01:01:24 -0400.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of files include: central, subject, and log book indexes.

did.physdesc: The Central Index cards for 1950-1974 are housed on 108 reels of 16mm microfilm, numbered Reel 001 to Reel 108. There are approximately 253,900 cards in this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Ford Foundation's Central Index cards covering the years 1950-1974 provide indexing to four types of records in the Ford Foundation archive:
Ford Foundation records, Grants (FA732)
Ford Foundation records, Projects (FA733)
Ford Foundation records, Log files (FA734)
Ford Foundation records, General Correspondence (FA735)
Indexed terms include organizational or institutional names, personal names, places, and subjects.

did.physdesc: The Central Index, 1975-1996 is housed on 68 reels of 16mm microfilm, and numbered Roll 1 to Roll 68. There are approximately 163,700 cards in this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Ford Foundation's Central Index cards for the years 1975-1996 provide access to three file-types in the Ford Foundation Archive:
Ford Foundation records, Grant files (FA732)
Ford Foundation records, Log files (grant and project proposals (FA734)
Ford Foundation records, General Correspondence files (FA735)
These three file-types are indexed by organizational/institutional names, personal names, and places.

did.unittitle: Cardoso, R. - Center for Regional Investigation
Center for Regional Planning - Chicago United
Debt Service Reserve Fund - Dirasse, L.
Ferraz, E. - Foundation for the Graduate
Foundation for the Graduate - Garcia, P.

Joint Committee on Eastern Europe - Kauffman, M.

National Legal Services - New York University
Pinchot Institute for Conservation - Pressley, C.
TRW Inc. - Urban Recovery Legal Assistance Project
Wilson, H. - World Wide Fund for Nature-India
World Wide Fund for Nature-India - Zemsky, R.

did.physdesc: This series of Subject Cards is housed on 7 reels of 16mm microfilm, numbered Roll 1 to Roll 7. There are approximately 9,900 cards in this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Central Index, 1975-1996 - Subject cards provide indexing to the same three file types as the Central Index cards:
Grant files (FA732)
Log files (grant and project proposals (FA734)
General Correspondence files (FA735)
However, the majority of files indexed in this series of cards are Grant files.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A digitized version of the Subject Cards is available to RAC archivists (except for Roll 2, which is missing from the digitized version). Please consult an Archivist for details.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The log books for Log Files (Grant and Project proposals) list all Ford Foundation Log Files from L51-001 to L81-168.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The log books for Grants and Projects lists Ford Foundation Project files, A-001 to A-1000, B-001 to B-499; Grant files, from PA53-001 to PA53-088 (including corresponding pre-1953 Project#); NY Fund projects NY-001 to NY-166; Project files B-500 to B-1000, C-1 to C-1000, D-1 to D-1000, E-1 to E-237; Grant files PA53-001 to PA74-985.

did.unittitle: NY Fund projects: NY-001 to NY-166

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Master Cards - Fund Files provide detailed description of Fund Files "A" through "X".

did.unittitle: "B" Fund for the Advancement of Education

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Ford Foundation records, Grants, 05300036 (PA53-36), The Fund For The Advancement Of Education.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Ford Foundation records, Grants 05300035 (PA53-35), The Fund For Adult Education.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Ford Foundation records, Grants, 05300031 (PA53-31), East European Fund, Inc.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Ford Foundation records, Grants 05300037 (PA53-37), The Fund For The Republic, Inc.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Ford Foundation records, Grants, 05300033 (PA53-33), Intercultural Publications, Inc.

did.unittitle: "M" Board on Overseas Training and Research
"S" Research and Training in Mental Health

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Master Cards - Projects provides information on Project Files NY-001 to NY-166; A-1 to A-745; B-1 to B-1000; C-1 to C-1000; D-1 to D-1000; E-1 to E-199.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Master Cards - Projects are arranged alpha-numerically by the Project file number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Master Cards - Grants provide information on Ford Foundation Grant files numbered PA53-1 to PA65-350. Each Master Card provides information regarding a grant's Name, Institution, Remittor, Recom. By, Purpose, Request, & Action.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Master Cards - Grants are arranged numerically by the Program Action (Grant) number.

did.physdesc: The Acronym Series cards are housed on 3 reels of 16mm microfilm, numbered Roll 1 to Roll 3.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The cards provide the full title of an institution/organization. These cards do not provide indexing to any of the file types in the Ford Foundation archives.
